description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on the Bailiwick of Guernsey and other top stories.
title: Coronavirus: Guernsey news and virus updates 20-24 July
title_page: Coronavirus: Guernsey news and virus updates 20-24 July - BBC News
maintext:
The States has "built in resilience" of extra coronavirus medical and testing equipment in the case of a second wave, chief executive Paul Whitfield said.
This includes a second standby testing setup that can be used if another goes down or to increase capacity.
Mr Whitfield argued "every jurisdiction is different" in their response to the pandemic, citing the move to face mask use in the UK shops and that the "near normal" life in Guernsey was distinct from the places around it.
He said work was being done to allow travel "in a safe way" to complement it, despite the short time frame in the "bigger scale of things".
